question: When is the International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation observed?
explanation:
The International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation is observed every year by the United Nations on February 6th. It was first observed in the year 2003.
This is a part of the UNâ€™s efforts to eradicate Female Genital Mutilation (FGM). The theme for this year is "No Time for Global Inaction, Unite, Fund, and Act to End Female Genital Mutilation."
